safety_edibility_notes: Protected endangered species. Illegal to hunt or trade in most countries. Bushmeat consumption occurs illegally in some regions.
safety_warning_text: Elephants kill approximately 500 people annually, more than any other large land animal. Most deaths occur during crop-raiding or when elephants are startled.
safety_summary: Despite their generally peaceful nature, African elephants are extremely dangerous when threatened, protecting young, or in musth. Give wide berth and never position yourself between an elephant and its escape route.
safety_contraindications: Keep vehicle between you and elephants
Watch for warning signs: ear flapping, trunk raised, mock charges
encounter_protocol: Remain in vehicle. Keep engine running. Give elephants right of way. If charged, reverse slowly. If on foot, freeze or move slowly behind cover.
